job_details.Vacaturetitel: Full Stack Software Developer | Accounts & Team Experience
job_details.Functieomschrijving:
DeepL, Europe's leading AI company since 2009, is dedicated to breaking down language barriers and bringing cultures closer together. Our expertise in AI and neural networks has enabled us to create cutting-edge communication technologies for businesses, including the acclaimed DeepL Translator which offers 30+ languages, and DeepL Write, our AI writing companion. Our core offering includes a suite of products and tools made for businesses to communicate more effectively, both internally and with their customers around the globe.

   Our goal is to become the global leader in Language AI and build products that help drive better communication, drive connection, and make real-life impact. To do that, we need talented people, like you, who want to be a part of this exciting journey. If you're ready to work with a dynamic team and build your career in the fast-moving AI space, DeepL is your next destination.

   What sets us apart

   We are committed to innovation and to a nurturing work environment. Founded by developers and researchers, we spend a lot of time actively reviewing the latest trends in generative AI and software engineering. Known for pioneering AI technologies, we dive deep into cutting-edge research to create not only translations, but advanced language solutions. Combining our use of modern technology, comprehensive employee benefits with our open and welcoming work culture is what sets us apart.

   When we tell people about DeepL as an employer, the reactions are overwhelmingly positive. Maybe it's because of the products that have helped countless people worldwide, or maybe it's because of our shared goal of improving communication for individuals and businesses worldwide. What we're certain of is this: being part of DeepL means joining a team committed to innovation and the well-being of its employees.

   Meet the team behind this journey

   DeepL delivers the world's best and most reliable translations directly to end users and enterprises alike. Many thousands of users and businesses make use of the various products in the DeepL ecosystem to drive value in their own use cases. Your role in this exciting landscape would be to join the Business Technology teams that make this access possible, working with session management, account and administrative management, billing and subscription data management and much more. The technology that drives these areas consists of .NET, Node.js, React, Kafka, amongst others. In a full-stack role, you would be pivotal to providing meaningful contributions to the product

   lifecycle through delivery of high quality features and insight into the architectural planning of the enterprise-grade software. The Business Technology teams consist of highly experienced professionals that are comfortable working in cross-functional spaces, regularly interfacing with various related teams, as well as the product management team

   Your responsibilities

   - Design, implement and maintain new features for the DeepL Business Technology space, collaborating with multiple engineering teams

   - Develop and maintain enterprise-level enablement services as per our technical agreements with customers and requirements from the product management team

   - Contribute to monitoring the services in production, e.g. by defining expressive metrics and ensuring informative logs

   What we offer

   - Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing-we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.

   - Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy makes us better together.
   - Remote work, flexible hours: whether you're near or in our hubs in cities like Cologne, Berlin, Amsterdam, London, or prefer the comfort of your own home, you decide where your office is. We offer remote opportunities, flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, all in sync with your team's general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration. Our aim is to integrate your work with your lifestyle, ensuring a balance that respects both your needs and our operational requirements.

   - Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings, to company-wide events that bring us all together-literally.

   - Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.

   - Comprehensive health insurance: your health comes first. With our comprehensive insurance, we'll make sure you're covered from head to toe.

   - 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.

   - Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we've set up an annual budget for your professional development-pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up.

   Qualities we look for

   - Technical Proficiency: You are proficient in C# with solid experience in both frontend and backend development, ideally also familiar with React and/or Typescript on the frontend.

   - Experience: You have a strong background in software engineering and have successfully developed and deployed software in a professional setting. Experience in AI, ML, or natural language processing would be a significant plus.

   - Problem-solving: You have robust problem-solving skills and can tackle complex technical challenges. You approach problems with an innovative mindset and are always ready to devise creative solution

   - Team Player: You thrive in a collaborative environment and can work effectively with cross-functional teams. Your communication skills are top-notch, and you are adept at articulating your ideas clearly.

   - Growth Mindset: You embrace the concept of continuous learning. You actively seek feedback, learn from your mistakes, and are proactive in improving your skills to keep up with the fast-paced tech industry.

   If this role and our mission resonate with you, but you're hesitant because you don't check all the boxes, don't let that hold you back. At DeepL, it's all about the value you bring and the growth we can foster together. Go ahead, apply-let's discover your potential together. We can't wait to meet you!

   Please make sure to send your application in English.

   #LI-DNI
job_details.full_text:
Full Stack Software Developer | Accounts & Team Experience

DeepL, Europe's leading AI company since 2009, is dedicated to breaking down language barriers and bringing cultures closer together. Our expertise in AI and neural networks has enabled us to create cutting-edge communication technologies for businesses, including the acclaimed DeepL Translator which offers 30+ languages, and DeepL Write, our AI writing companion. Our core offering includes a suite of products and tools made for businesses to communicate more effectively, both internally and with their customers around the globe.

   Our goal is to become the global leader in Language AI and build products that help drive better communication, drive connection, and make real-life impact. To do that, we need talented people, like you, who want to be a part of this exciting journey. If you're ready to work with a dynamic team and build your career in the fast-moving AI space, DeepL is your next destination.

   What sets us apart

   We are committed to innovation and to a nurturing work environment. Founded by developers and researchers, we spend a lot of time actively reviewing the latest trends in generative AI and software engineering. Known for pioneering AI technologies, we dive deep into cutting-edge research to create not only translations, but advanced language solutions. Combining our use of modern technology, comprehensive employee benefits with our open and welcoming work culture is what sets us apart.

   When we tell people about DeepL as an employer, the reactions are overwhelmingly positive. Maybe it's because of the products that have helped countless people worldwide, or maybe it's because of our shared goal of improving communication for individuals and businesses worldwide. What we're certain of is this: being part of DeepL means joining a team committed to innovation and the well-being of its employees.

   Meet the team behind this journey

   DeepL delivers the world's best and most reliable translations directly to end users and enterprises alike. Many thousands of users and businesses make use of the various products in the DeepL ecosystem to drive value in their own use cases. Your role in this exciting landscape would be to join the Business Technology teams that make this access possible, working with session management, account and administrative management, billing and subscription data management and much more. The technology that drives these areas consists of .NET, Node.js, React, Kafka, amongst others. In a full-stack role, you would be pivotal to providing meaningful contributions to the product

   lifecycle through delivery of high quality features and insight into the architectural planning of the enterprise-grade software. The Business Technology teams consist of highly experienced professionals that are comfortable working in cross-functional spaces, regularly interfacing with various related teams, as well as the product management team

   Your responsibilities

   - Design, implement and maintain new features for the DeepL Business Technology space, collaborating with multiple engineering teams

   - Develop and maintain enterprise-level enablement services as per our technical agreements with customers and requirements from the product management team

   - Contribute to monitoring the services in production, e.g. by defining expressive metrics and ensuring informative logs

   What we offer

   - Diverse and internationally distributed team: joining our team means becoming part of a large, global community with people of more than 90 nationalities. We're more than just colleagues; we're a group of professionals with a shared mission to connect diverse cultures. Our global presence is growing-we've doubled in size nearly every year, with our employees based in the UK, Germany, the Netherlands, Poland, the US, and Japan, and we continue to expand our network.

   - Open communication, regular feedback: as a language-focused company, we value the importance of clear, honest communication. We value smooth collaboration, direct and actionable feedback, and believe that leading with empathy makes us better together.
   - Remote work, flexible hours: whether you're near or in our hubs in cities like Cologne, Berlin, Amsterdam, London, or prefer the comfort of your own home, you decide where your office is. We offer remote opportunities, flexible working hours and trust in your productivity, all in sync with your team's general locations and time zones to foster effective and seamless collaboration. Our aim is to integrate your work with your lifestyle, ensuring a balance that respects both your needs and our operational requirements.

   - Regular in-person team events: we bond over vibrant events that are as unique as our team, from local team and business unit gatherings, to new-joiner onboardings, to company-wide events that bring us all together-literally.

   - Monthly full-day hacking sessions: every month, we have Hack Fridays, where you can spend your time diving into a project you're passionate about and get the opportunity to work with other teams-we value your initiatives, impact, and creativity.

   - Comprehensive health insurance: your health comes first. With our comprehensive insurance, we'll make sure you're covered from head to toe.

   - 30 days of annual leave: we value your peace of mind. With 30 days off (excluding public holidays) and access to mental health resources, we make sure you're as strong mentally as you are professionally.

   - Annual learning budget: because we never stop learning, we've set up an annual budget for your professional development-pick a learning path which contributes to your career development and we'll back you up.

   Qualities we look for

   - Technical Proficiency: You are proficient in C# with solid experience in both frontend and backend development, ideally also familiar with React and/or Typescript on the frontend.

   - Experience: You have a strong background in software engineering and have successfully developed and deployed software in a professional setting. Experience in AI, ML, or natural language processing would be a significant plus.

   - Problem-solving: You have robust problem-solving skills and can tackle complex technical challenges. You approach problems with an innovative mindset and are always ready to devise creative solution

   - Team Player: You thrive in a collaborative environment and can work effectively with cross-functional teams. Your communication skills are top-notch, and you are adept at articulating your ideas clearly.

   - Growth Mindset: You embrace the concept of continuous learning. You actively seek feedback, learn from your mistakes, and are proactive in improving your skills to keep up with the fast-paced tech industry.

   If this role and our mission resonate with you, but you're hesitant because you don't check all the boxes, don't let that hold you back. At DeepL, it's all about the value you bring and the growth we can foster together. Go ahead, apply-let's discover your potential together. We can't wait to meet you!

   Please make sure to send your application in English.

   #LI-DNI

profile_classification.rationale: The job description focuses heavily on full-stack software development, .NET, Node.js, and React, with a mention of AI/ML as a 'significant plus' rather than a core requirement. While DeepL is an AI company, this specific role is for a 'Full Stack Software Developer' within their 'Business Technology' team, emphasizing enterprise-grade software development, session management, account management, and billing. The core responsibilities and required technical proficiencies (C#, frontend/backend development) do not align with the specialized tasks of an ML Engineer or GenAI Engineer as defined in the Coding Book. The role is more about building and maintaining business-critical software that *uses* AI technologies rather than developing or engineering AI models themselves. Therefore, it falls under the 'Ambiguous' category due to its primary focus on traditional software engineering with AI as a secondary benefit.

job_tasks.justification: The job description explicitly mentions 'Full Stack Software Developer', 'frontend and backend development', 'design, implement and maintain new features', 'develop and maintain enterprise-level enablement services', and 'delivery of high quality features'. It also lists required technical proficiencies in C#, React, and Node.js, which are core to software development.

The role involves building and maintaining enterprise-grade software, including aspects like session management, account and administrative management, and billing and subscription data management, which are typical of backend and full-stack development.
The responsibilities include designing, implementing, and maintaining new features, which is a fundamental software development task.
job_tasks.phrase: Design, implement and maintain new features

job_tasks.justification: Developing and maintaining services as per technical agreements and product requirements falls under the scope of software development.
job_tasks.phrase: Develop and maintain enterprise-level enablement services

job_tasks.justification: The responsibility to 'contribute to monitoring the services in production, e.g. by defining expressive metrics and ensuring informative logs' aligns with operational aspects of deployed software, which is a component of MLOps.
job_tasks.phrase: Contribute to monitoring the services in production

job_tasks.justification: The role is within 'Business Technology' and involves working with 'session management, account and administrative management, billing and subscription data management', indicating a need to understand business processes and translate them into technical solutions.
job_tasks.phrase: account and administrative management, billing and subscription data management

job_tasks.justification: While not a primary focus, the job description mentions 'Experience in AI, ML, or natural language processing would be a significant plus', indicating some potential involvement or understanding of modeling concepts.
job_tasks.phrase: Experience in AI, ML, or natural language processing
